alert.note: Alert for Duplin; Onslow (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 31 at 9:02AM EDT until August 31 at 11:15AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Duplin County in eastern North Carolina... Onslow County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 1115 AM EDT. * At 902 AM EDT, Emergency management reported ongoing flash flooding across the warned area. Between 5 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing in many locations and is expected to begin shortly in others. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jacksonville, North Topsail Beach, Wallace, Warsaw, Half Moon, New River Station, Pumpkin Center, Camp Lejeune Center, Piney Green, Swansboro, Hubert, Rose Hill, Richlands, Beulaville, Cypress Creek, Catherine Lake, Verona, Dixon, Folkstone and Kellum. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
